briefdescription.para: Length of hardware address (6 for MAC)
Length of protocol address (4 for IPv4)
Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)

detaileddescription.para: Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Send an ARP packet via the Ethernet driver.
Perform a blocking ARP lookup to resolve an IP address.

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer for resolved MAC address

simplesect.para: int Non-zero on success, zero on failure or timeout

briefdescription.para: Manually add an ARP entry to the local cache.
Retrieve a pointer to an ARP table entry by index.

detaileddescription.para: Primarily used by the BASIC interpreter for table enumeration.

simplesect.para: arp_table_entry_t* Pointer to ARP entry, or NULL if out of range

briefdescription.para: Get the current number of ARP table entries.

detaileddescription.para: Used by the BASIC interpreter to determine iteration limits.

simplesect.para: size_t Number of valid entries in the ARP table

briefdescription.para: Pre-cache a likely-to-be-used IP address in the ARP table.

detaileddescription.para: Used to resolve IPs such as the gateway or DNS server early, avoiding runtime lookup delays.

parameterdescription.para: IP address to resolve and cache

briefdescription.para: ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) implementation for Retro Rocket.
